intro: Sium sisarum subsp. sisaroideum, commonly known as the eastern water parsnip, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, stream banks, and wet meadows. It has a distinctive aromatic scent and contains compounds that can cause skin irritation. This subspecies is native to eastern North America and is often found in riparian habitats.
